// Define menu options through the actions attribute
Popover supports two styles: light and dark. The default is light style. Set the
causes the menu options to be arranged horizontally.
attribute to control the pop-up position of the bubble.

props.code:
top # Top middle position
top-start # Top left position
top-end # Top right position
left # left middle position
left-start # The upper left position
left-end # The lower left position
right # middle position on the right
right-start # The upper right position
right-end # The lower right position
bottom # bottom middle position
bottom-start #bottom left position
bottom-end # bottom right position

children.value: array, the icon of the option can be defined through the
field, which supports passing in the icon name or image link, which is equivalent to the
array, an option can be disabled via the
Default slots allow you to place any content inside the Popover.

props.code:
<z-popover
   v-model:show="show.customContent"
   placement="top-start"
   @select="onSelect"
>
   <z-grid
     square
     clickable
     :border="false"
     column-num="3"
     :custom-style="{ width: '480rpx' }"
   >
     <z-grid-item
       v-for="i in 6"
       :key="i"
       icon="image"
       text="options"
       @click="show.customContent = false"
     />
   </z-grid>
   <template #reference>
     <z-button type="primary"> Custom content </z-button>
   </template>
</z-popover>

import { ref } from 'vue';
const showPopover = ref(false);

children.value: You can use Popover as a controlled or uncontrolled component:
is bound, Popover is a controlled component, and the display of the component is completely determined by the value of
is not bound, Popover is an uncontrolled component. At this time, you can pass in a default value through the
attribute, and the display of the component value is controlled by the component itself.
Whether to display the bubble popup layer
The arrangement direction of the option list, the optional value is
animation duration in milliseconds, set to 0 to disable animation
whether to display the mask layer
Whether to close the option after clicking it
Whether to close the menu after clicking on an external element
Whether to close the menu after clicking the overlay
Icon class name prefix, equivalent to the
attribute is a number consisting of objectsGroup, each object in the array is configured with one column, and the objects can contain the following values:
The icon to the left of the text, supports passing in the icon name or image link, which is equivalent to the
Add an additional class name for the corresponding option
Triggered when an option is clicked
Triggered when the menu is opened
Triggered after the menu is opened and the animation ends
Triggered after the menu is closed and the animation ends
Triggered when the overlay layer is clicked
The content of the element that triggers the Popover to display
